snippet: Since Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl was freed after years in captivity, a number of the men who served with him have called him a deserter. Some have gone further, blaming him for the deaths of six to eight soldiers.
abstract: Number of men who served with former prisoner of war Sgt Bowe Bergdahl have called him a deserter, with some going further and blaming him for the deaths of six to eight soldiers; review of casualty reports and contemporaneous military logs from Afghanistan war show that facts surrounding eight deaths are far murkier than definitive.

byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and ANDREW W. LEHREN
byline.contributor: Charlie Savage reported from Washington, and Andrew W. Lehren from New York. Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Since Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl was freed after years in captivity, a number of the men who served with him have called him a deserter. Some have gone further, blaming him for the deaths of six to eight soldiers.

headline.main: Can Bowe Bergdahl Be Tied to 6 Lost Lives? Facts Are Murky
headline.print_headline: Can G.I. Be Tied to 6 Lost Lives? Facts Are Murky
